header_note: RBI frequently updates master directions for banking services. Here are the core protections every depositor should know.
disclaimer: This information is summarized from RBI's 'Customer Service' guidelines. For official legal text, always refer to the RBI Master Circulars.

items.title: Banking Ombudsman
items.content: If your bank does not resolve your complaint within 30 days, you can approach the RBI Banking Ombudsman. It is a free and official channel for grievance redressal.

items.title: Deposit Insurance (DICGC)
items.content: Each depositor in a bank is insured up to a maximum of â‚¹5,00,000 (five lakhs) for both principal and interest amount held by them in the same capacity and same right.

items.title: Zero Liability for Fraud
items.content: You have zero liability for unauthorized electronic transactions if you report them to the bank within 3 working days of the occurrence.

items.title: Bank Locker Liability
items.content: Banks are liable for an amount equivalent to 100 times the prevailing annual rent of the safe deposit locker in case of fire, theft, or building collapse.
